name: Data Protection Principles
definition: Core principles governing lawful, fair and transparent data processing

name: Lawfulness
definition: Personal data must be processed lawfully and on a lawful basis

name: Fairness
definition: Personal data must be processed fairly without discrimination

name: Transparency
definition: Data processing must be transparent to data subject with clear privacy notices

name: Purpose Limitation
definition: Personal data collected for specified purposes cannot be reprocessed for incompatible purposes

name: Data Minimization
definition: Personal data must be adequate, relevant, limited to what is necessary (necessity and proportionality)

name: Accuracy
definition: Personal data must be accurate, complete and kept up to date with reasonable efforts to correct or delete inaccurate data

name: Storage Limitation
definition: Personal data kept in form which permits identification of data subject only as long as necessary

name: Integrity and Confidentiality
definition: Personal data processed in manner ensuring appropriate security through technical and organizational measures

name: Accountability
definition: Controller responsible for demonstrating compliance with all principles through documentation and implementation
